post.summary: Place a product directly into a location.
post.description: The direct putaway endpoint offers a way to tell eManager that a product is placed in a given location. This is used to bypass the regular inbound process.

parameters.name: putaway
parameters.description: Offers a single operation of placing a product into a location.

put.summary: Complete or delete putaway tasks for a purchase line ID.
put.description:
If the task status is below *PutInBox (5)*, it will be deleted.
If it is *PutInBox (5)* or higher, it will be set to *Completed (17)*.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Purchase order ID

parameters.name: lineId
parameters.description: Purchase line ID. The purchase line to complete.

404.description: No putaway order lines found for the given purchase ID

delete.summary: Delete a goods receival order line

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Purchase order ID

parameters.name: lineId
parameters.description: Purchase line ID. The purchase line to delete.

post.summary: Imports a goods receival list into the system.

202.description: The goods receival import is started.

400.description: BadRequest. Either there was no lines present in the request or the lines could not be parsed.

post.summary: Routes the request message to the configured endpoint. See documentation on how to configure this.

202.description: Message is routed to correct endpoint and import started.

400.description: BadRequest. Either there was no content in the request or the content could not be parsed.

get.description:
Will return the integration status when given a valid integration transaction id. 

Statuses:
**ExportCreated** - We have created an entry for the integration transaction
**Started** - The integration transaction is started
**Ok** - The integration transaction was completed successfully
**Error** - The integration transaction failed

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The integration transaction id.

200.description: Ok. The integration transaction is returned.

404.description: Not found. The integration transaction does not exist.

post.summary: Imports inventory count list into the system.

400.description: BadRequest. Either there was no inventory count lines present in the request or the lines could not be parsed.

patch.summary: Apply updates to all locations matching filter.
patch.description:
The message is a JSON object consisting of two fields: Filter and Updates.
Allocation data will be updated with the given Updates data for all locations matching the Filter criteria.
            
The API will not perform any reallocation. All existing allocations will be kept as is.Only new orders will be impacted by the update.
            
The Filter section is required, and must at minimum include a SkuNumber or HandlingUnit (or both).
Either SkuNumber or HandlingUnit (or both) is required for the Filter.
            
Sending a message without the optional Updates section can be useful for testing the API.
Sending in an empty string "" as the value for a field in the Updates section will clear that field.

parameters.name: updateAllocationData
parameters.description: JSON containing a Filter and a set of Updates. Applies Updates to all locations matching Filter.

200.description: The products matching your filter (if any) have been updated.

400.description: Either there was a problem parsing your request, or your values were not acceptable.

207.description: One or more request failed. Check response for details

400.description: Locking of all the products failed

207.description: One or more request failed. Check response for details

400.description: Unlocking of all the products failed

post.summary: Transforms and forwards a request to a configured endpoint

parameters.name: routingName
parameters.description:
The name of the routing to be used for the request. Routings are specified in the
Integration.MessageRoutingConfiguration configuration parameter

200.description: The request is transformed and routed to the configured endpoint

400.description: Either there was no content in the request or the content contains invalid data

415.description: The content type is not application/json

delete.description: Id is the same as the ExtPicklistId from the import and lineId is the same as ExtOrderLineId from the import.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Picklist ID

parameters.name: lineId
parameters.description: Picklist line ID. The picklist line to delete.

403.description: Forbidden. The requested picklist line could not be deleted since the picklist is in the process of being picked

404.description: NotFound. The requested picklist line could not be found

post.description: ExtPicklistId and ExtOrderLineId is the same as from the import.

parameters.name: extPicklistId
parameters.description: Picklist ID

parameters.name: extOrderLineId
parameters.description: Orderline ID. The orderline to delete.

200.description: Ok. The picklist line is completed

404.description: NotFound. The requested picklist line could not be found

409.description: Conflict. The picklist line is already completed or is currently being picked

delete.description: Picklist ID is the same as the ExtPicklistId which was supplied in the import.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Picklist ID. The id of the picklist to delete.

403.description: Forbidden. The requested picklist could not be deleted since the picklist is in the process of being picked

404.description: NotFound. The requested picklist could not be found

post.description: Picklist ID is the same as the ExtPicklistId which was supplied in the import.

parameters.name: extPicklistId
parameters.description: Picklist ID. The id of the picklist to complete.

schema.description: Defines a command that asynchronously creates an {System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage}.

404.description: NotFound. The requested picklist could not be found

post.summary: Imports one picklist into the system.

400.description: BadRequest. Either there was no picklist lines present in the request or the lines could not be parsed.

200.description: Ok. All the configured pickwaves is returned.

parameters.name: pickwaveId
parameters.description: The pickwave id

200.description: Ok. The requested pickwave is returned.

400.description: BadRequest. The parameter could not be parsed.

404.description: NotFound. The requested pickwave was not found.

post.summary:
Adds additional scan codes to existing product without affecting any existing codes on the product.
Existing codes with "Unknown" type will get their type updated if the code is added with a different type specified.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: SKU of the product

parameters.name: scanCodes
parameters.description: Collection of scan codes to add to the product

200.description: OK. The scan codes were accepted and added to the product.

400.description: BadRequest. Either no scan codes where provided or one or more of the scan codes were empty or with invalid type.

delete.summary: Deletes one product from the system if possible.

parameters.name: extProductId
parameters.description: Id of the product to be deleted

200.description: OK. The product has been successfully deleted from the system.

post.summary: Imports product list into the system.

400.description: BadRequest. Either there was no product lines present in the request or the lines could not be parsed.

schema.description: Defines a command that asynchronously creates an {System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage}.

200.description: List of all unprepared refill orders is returned

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: External Order Id

200.description: Given refill order info is returned

404.description: No refill activity found for given ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: External Order Id

200.description: Given refill order has been prepared

TransactionId.description: A unique ID for this transaction

LocationCode.description: The bin ID with the location code the item is put into.

TaskListId.description: Maps to 'Ext.OrderID'. If a valid TaskListId and TaskLineId is provided and the quantity matches the task line’s quantity, the task line will be marked as completed and closed. If there is no match, the direct putaway will be performed and registered as performed with the optional ID's provided.

TaskLineId.description: Maps to 'Ext.OrderLineID'. If a valid TaskListId and TaskLineId is provided and the quantity matches the task line’s quantity, the task line will be marked as completed and closed. If there is no match, the direct putaway will be performed and registered as performed with the optional ID's provided.

SkuNumber.description: Maps to Ext.ProductId. The ID of the products stored

UserCode.description: The ID of the user performing the putaway

BatchId.description: Used to assign the products with a batch ID. Used for picking. A picklist can contain a batch ID to make sure a specific product batch is picked.

LotNumber.description: Lot numbers are used to track items throughout the manufacturing process and can be used to identify recalled items or products with defects

ExpiryDate.description: Used to track the Expiry Date of products.

Returned.description: Used to track if the item is a return

IsAvailable.description:
Locks a product for reservation. All existing reservations will be removed. Use the *unlock* API to unlock. 

Useful for locking items while they are outside AutoStore when using an external putaway process.

StockReservationKey.description: Specify a Stock Reservation Key. If included, the item can only be picked if its stock reservation key is included in a picklist.

CustomAllocationData.description: Used for non standard properties, e.g. country of origin or color.

ProblemDetails.description: A machine-readable format for specifying errors in HTTP API responses based on https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7807.

type.description:
A URI reference [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type. This specification encourages that, when
dereferenced, it provides human-readable documentation for the problem type
(e.g., using HTML [W3C.REC-html5-20141028]). When this member is not present, its value is assumed to be
"about:blank".

status.description: The HTTP status code([RFC7231], Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description:
A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information
if dereferenced.

When replenishing AutoStore with task groups, request time is primarily used. If request times are equal, OrderPriority is considered next.
Picklists with the lowest OrderPriority will be prioritized.

ExtPicklistLineId.description: Unique identifier for each order line

ExtPicklistHeaderId.description: Header ID for CSV column mapping

OrderLineNote2.description: Sub note for the order line

Info1.description: Used in exports. Can be configured to be visible in the picking UI

Info2.description: Used in exports. Can be configured to be visible in the picking UI

Info3.description: Used in exports. Can be configured to be visible in the picking UI

Info4.description: Used in exports. Can be configured to be visible in the picking UI

OrderText1.description: Often used for instructions. Can be configured to be visible in the picking UI
OrderText1.example: Pack this in a specific way

OrderText2.description: Often used for instructions. Can be configured to be visible in the picking UI
OrderText2.example: This is shipped to Sentinel Island

Sequence.description:
Picking order. It determines the sequence AutoStore presents bins in.
The sequence identifier is a string, and need not be unique.
If all the lines in an order have either the sequence identifier "A" or the sequence identifier "B", all the lines with "A" will be picked before all the lines with "B".
Sorted as strings, so '11' will be picked before '2'.
Sequence can be used e.g. to pick heavy goods before lighter goods.
            
NOTE: Using sequence identifiers impacts performance, and should only be used when absolutely necessary.

Boxtype.description:
The name of the boxtype.
If set, the boxtype will be chosen for the picklistline and shown in the UI if configured.
If the boxtype doesn't exist, a new boxtype will automatically be created.

ShipmentId.description: ID for shipments. Used in exports

TmsCustomerId.description: Customer ID used for TMS purposes

OwnerCode.description: Owner of the product, used by 3PLs to identify client goods

ProductLabels.description:
Number of copies of the product lables to print.
Not set will print nothing
0 or less will print the same amount as items picked
More than 0 will print the amount defined

ProductScancodes.description: Comma-separated list of product scan codes

StockReservationKey.description:
Key for stock reservation.
This stock will be locked, and can only be assigned to pick orders requesting reservations with that specific StockReservationKey.

StockAvailabilityHandling.description:
Defines what to do with incomplete picked order lines.
Used to override the value of the StockAvailabilityHandling parameter.
            
*AllowPartial* - Allows lines to be partially assigned and still proceed to be picked - this is generally not recommended at this can cause the order to be split into multiple taskgroups and thereby multiple deliveries, which is generally not desired.
*WaitForComplete* - Will keep the line in unassigned until all the quantity can be assigned. NOTE: parameter "Integration.BalanceCorrection.External" needs to be disabled when using this setting.
*FinishRestQuantity* - Will automatically finish the part of the quantity that can not be picked and allow the remaining quantity to be picked.
*FinishIncomplete (default)* - automatically finish lines where we cannot pick the full quantity.

ExpiryDateRequired.description: When you have an orderline with ExpiryDateRequired=1 the operator must enter the expiry date manually before performing putaway.

ExpiryDateFilter.description:
limits the available stock items to those that have an expiry date that falls within the range of the filter
Used to filter by specific dates or an interval. Example: in order to get items that are expiring 2 days from today to 7 days from today.
Explicit dates can also be used, such as: 2022.08.23..2022.08.27.

SalesUnitWeight.description: Weight of a single sales unit

SalesUnitWidth.description: Width of a single sales unit

SalesUnitDepth.description: Depth of a single sales unit

SalesUnitHeight.description: Height of a single sales unit

SalesUnitVolume.description: Volume of a single sales unit

InvoiceAmount.description: Invoice amount. Used often to map price per location

TotalInvoiceAmount.description: Total invoice amount. Used often by 3PLs

InvoiceNumber.description: Total invoice amount. Used often by 3PLs

ReceiverMail.description:
Email of the reciever
GDPR sensitive property. Not logged with log4net.

ReceiverPhone.description:
Phone of the reciever
GDPR sensitive property. Not logged with log4net.

SenderMail.description:
Mail of the sender
GDPR sensitive property. Not logged with log4net.

SenderPhone.description:
Phone of the sender
GDPR sensitive property. Not logged with log4net.

ValidateQuantityAbove.description: Set to alert the user if quantity to pick is above the quantity defined.

UnmannedPickability.description: Pickability rating. Useful for Robotic Piece Picking

FrequencyGroup.description:
Pick frequency group (0-3: Unknown, A, B, C)
Used during putaway to put items of the same frequency group in the same bin.

CustomAllocationData.description:
This field can be used to send key value pairs to eManager (e.g. "CustomData": {"key1": "value1", "key2": "value2"}
The data will be saved in a PUTAWAYORDERLINECUSTOMALLOCATIONDATA table with a foreign key to picklistline.
The CustomAllocationData properties will be stored on the product location during putaway and can be used to
allocate pick locations. Max length : 500.
The CustomAllocationData element may contain any number of items.

PicklistLookupCode.description:
A code that can be set to make it easier to look up the specific picklist in the "Pick Single Picklist"
category from the task menu, if the Picking.FindPicklistByLookupCodeEnabled parameter is enabled.

QuantityVerificationThreshold.description:
Value for a threshold that will force counting when the balance at a location is at or below that threshold.
Note that this feature does not work with Handling Units

HandlingUnitScanCode.description: The code of the hanadling unit to be picked. This is a unique code for a specific unique handling unit in the system.

HandlingUnitStrategy.description:
A field used to indicate the type of strategy used to pick handling units for the picklistline.
The value will default to "10" if not set which means that the handling unit to be picked will always be picked in full,
which was the default behaviour before this property was introduced
(e.g. quantity to be picked is 10, and the handling unit contains 20, users will be forced to pick the full handling unit).
While a value of "20" will allow the handling unit to be picked in parts
(e.g. quantity to be picked is 10, but the handling unit contains 20,
users will be allowed to split the handling unit and only pick the partial handling unit).

ScanCode.description: Defines a scan code with type

Code.description: String representation of the code it self
